datanetwork
Class Responder

java.lang.Object
  datanetwork.Responder

public class Responder
extends java.lang.Object

Simple class that catches the reply from the server to a specific message. Certain messages sent to the server require replies from the server to arcknolege their reception. This class provides that functionality. If the reply to the sent message has not been received within 2 seconds, the timeout() will issue an error message.

Part of Sense/Stage

OSC classes are based on Java OSC. Copyright (c) 2002-2006, C. Ramakrishnan / Illposed Software

Version:
001
Author:
Vincent de Belleval
See Also:
DNConnection, OSCPortIn, OSCPortOut

Constructor Detail

Responder

public Responder(OSCPortIn in,
                 OSCMessage msg,
                 OSCMessage rsp)
Constructs a Responder which adds itself as a listener on the DNConnection's OSCPortIn for a specific reply. Starts a timer thread which will call timeout() after 2 seconds unless it reveives the correct reply.

Parameters:
in - DNConnection's incoming port.
msg - message sent for which a reply is expected.
rsp - the reply message this Responder is waiting for.
See Also:
DNConnection, OSCPortIn, OSCPortOut
Method Detail

acceptMessage

public void acceptMessage(OSCMessage message)
Interface method from OSCListener to recieve messages. Once the correct reply has been received, it will attempt to interrupt the timer thread as well as to remove itself as a listener.

Parameters:
message - OSCMessage received on a OSCPortIn listener.
See Also:
OSCListener, OSCPortIn, OSCMessage
